negotiator.utility

Interface UtilitySpace

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUtilitySpace, AdditiveUtilitySpace, ConstraintUtilitySpace, NonlinearUtilitySpace

    public interface UtilitySpace
extends java.io.Serializable
    A utility space is a function that maps bids to utilities.
    Author:
    W.Pasman 5nov15

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      UtilitySpace copy() 
      java.lang.Double discount(double util, double time)

    • Method Detail

      • getDomain

        Domain getDomain()
        Returns:
        domain belonging to this preference profile.

      • getUtility

        double getUtility(Bid bid)
        Parameters:
        bid - of which we are interested in its utility.
        Returns:
        Utility of the given bid. This utility is undiscounted: there is no time dependent devaluation of the utility. See also discount(double, double).
        Throws:
        (may - throw) if the Bid's Domain does not match our domain.

      • discount

        java.lang.Double discount(double util,
                        double time)
        Computes the discounted utility of a bid. The actual implementation is implementation specific but we assume that this function is monotonically decreasing so that the discount at time 1.0 gives the biggest possible discount.
        Parameters:
        util - the undiscounted utility as coming from getUtility(Bid).
        time - a real number in the range [0,1] where 0 is the start of the negotiation and 1 the end. See also TimeLineInfo.
        Returns:
        the time-discounted utility at given time.

      • copy

        UtilitySpace copy()
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this utility space.

      • isComplete

        java.lang.String isComplete()
        Check if this utility space is complete and ready for negotiation.
        Returns:
        null if util space is complete, else returns String containing explanation why not.

      • toXML

        SimpleElement toXML()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an xml representation (in the form of a SimpleElements) of the utilityspace.
        Returns:
        A representation of this utilityspace or null when there was an error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Classes must implement equals. Not sure if this does anything.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare with
        Returns:
        true iff utility spaces are equal.

      • getReservationValue

        java.lang.Double getReservationValue()
        The reservation value is the least favourable point at which one will accept a negotiated agreement. Also sometimes referred to as the walk away point.

        This is value remains constant during the negotiation. However, by default, the reservation value descreases with time. Refer to discount(double, double) or use support functions.

        Returns:
        undiscounted reservation value of the preference profile (may be null).
